qas.question: What countries surround the border that is opposite the southwest border of Burma?

answers.text: Burma is bordered in the northwest by the Chittagong Division of Bangladesh and the Mizoram

qas.question: What sea is an integral part of the Burma landscape ?

answers.text: Andaman Sea to the southwest and the south, which forms one quarter of its total perimeter.

qas.question: How many miles of uninterrupted coastline does Burma encompass?
What is the name of the bay along the southwest coast of Burma ?
What region lays along the north border of Burma and is famed for the presence of monks ?

context: <a0_0>Burma is bordered in the northwest by the Chittagong Division of Bangladesh and the Mizoram<a0_0/>, Manipur, Nagaland and Arunachal Pradesh states of India. Its north and northeast border is with <a4_0>the Tibet Autonomous Region<a4_0/> and Yunnan province for a Sino-Burman border total of 2,185 km (1,358 mi). It is bounded by Laos and Thailand to the southeast. Burma has 1,930 km (<a2_0>1,200 mi<a2_0/>) of contiguous coastline along the <a3_0>Bay of Bengal<a3_0/> and <a1_0>Andaman Sea to the southwest and the south, which forms one quarter of its total perimeter.
